page.title: 13COUSLAND'S ARTIST
page.content: THE OLD VILLAGE SCHOOL AND SCHOOL-HOUSE ARE THE HOME AND STUDIO OF ALASTAIR BUCHANAN, WHO IS AN ARTIST. SINCE HE PAINTS IN GOUACHE, HE USUALLY SKETCHES HIS WORK OUTSIDE, BUT FINISHES IT INSIDE SO THAT IT WON'T BE SPOILED BY RAIN. HE USES MANY BRUSHES, AS THEY HAVE TO BE THROWN AWAY OFTEN, SPOILED BY THE GOUACHE. HE PAINTS ON THICK BOARD, WITH PAPER STUCK ON TOP TO GIVE A GOOD QUALITY FINISH. WITH THE HELP OF A VICTORIAN GUILLOTINE, HE MAKES HIS OWN FRAMES. FIFE FISHING VILLAGES AND FISHING BOATS ARE THE SUBJECTS HE ENJOYS MOST, BECAUSE HE IS INTERESTED IN MAKING HIS PAINTINGS SHOW THE PAST. HE OFTEN PUTS OLD SCENES BACK INTO PAINTINGS, USING HIS IMAGINATION AND REMOVING SUCH THINGS AS TELEVISION AERIALS AND CHIMNEYS.
